title: Indian Designers
content:
Hi   
   
Can anyone help me with a few questions.   
   
- Do you know of any Indian Designers   
- Do you know of any Indian Design Companies   
   
Thanks   
   
Jim   
===
author: union

comments.content:
Jim,   
   
Please specify Native Indian or East Indian?   
   
gln

The only "Eastern Indian" type designer I know is R K Joshi, but he's massively significant.   
I don't know of any Amerind type designers.   
   
hhp

Hi I meant East Indian. I have heard of RK Roshi, but all the web links I've found to him (mainly on Luc's site) are out of date.   
   
Do you know of any active links to his work?   
   
Thanks   
   
JIM   
===

I have a very good friend that is from India and is a graphic designer.   
   
He lives in Wisconsin.

\> Do you know of any active links to his work?   
   
Let me try to get more knowledgable people over here.   
   
hhp

i was searching for some indic fonts a couple months back and found C-DAC has some really beautiful fonts. If yer familiar with Luc's pages, he has a link on his Indic page to their typography website. unfortunately, i didn't find any designer information in conjunction with their excellent faces. but they're worth looking at!

Due to the nature of Indic fonts you'll find most of the the current designers over at [http://groups.msn.com/MicrosoftVOLTuserscommunity](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011113857/http:/groups.msn.com/MicrosoftVOLTuserscommunity)   
   
Cheers, Si

Jim,   
   
I can send you Joshi's email if it would help.   
   
Are you interested in Indian designers, or designers of fonts in Indic scripts?   
Fiona

Hi Fiona   
   
Both Indian desigenrs and Indic fonts. The reason is building letters ( [http://www.buildingletters.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011113857/http:/www.buildingletters.org/) ) I am researching the next issue which may focus on India.   
   
Jim

Oh and Joshi's email would be very, very helpful, thanks (my email address is jim at unionfonts.com). I see your new to the board, and a fellow Brit, what's your interest in type?   
   
Jim
